article.name: Defend - Admin Notifications Email Address for UK Customers
article.title: Defend - Admin Notifications Email Address for UK Customers
article.body:
The Defend AWS host was changed from defend.egress.com to uk.defend.egress.com. This action has resulted in our notification address changing to:

notifications@uk.defend.egress.com

If you have a Microsoft Outlook rule to filter these notifications into another folder, you may wish to update the rules accordingly with the new address.

images.alt:
This image displays a configuration screen for creating an automated email processing rule, titled **"Rules."**

The rule is structured into three main sections, each indicated by a checked circle icon:

1.  **Rule Name:** An input field containing the text **"Defend Notifications."**
2.  **Add a condition:** This section defines the criteria for the rule:
    *   **Condition 1:** Uses the dropdown value **"From"** and specifies two source addresses as tags: `notifications@defend.egress.com` and `notifications@uk.defend.egress.com`.
    *   **Condition 2:** A standalone condition dropdown set to **"I'm on the To line."**
    *   A link **"Add another condition"** is present below the defined criteria.
3.  **Add an action:** This section defines the actions taken when conditions are met:
    *   **Action 1:** Uses the dropdown **"Move to"** and specifies the target folder dropdown as **"Defend notifications"** (marked with a folder icon).
    *   **Action 2:** A standalone action dropdown set to **"Mark as read."**
    *   A link **"Add another action"** is present below the defined actions.

All input/dropdown lines feature an "X" icon for deletion.
